description.narrative: Educational structures in priority regions offer quality, protective, clean and inclusive learning opportunities to girls and boys aged 6 to 12 years, including for those out-of-school and the most disadvantaged., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Skills Development, Social Protection, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most-deprived and hard-to-reach children aged 6 to 12 years have increased access to gender-responsive and integrated quality basic social services in a protective, safe and clean environment, including in humanitarian situations.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Education and training in water supply and sanitation
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
United Nations Girls' Education Initiative (UNGEI) Secretariat
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Educational structures in priority regions offer quality, protective, clean and inclusive learning opportunities to girls and boys aged 6 to 12 years, including for those out-of-school and the most disadvantaged.
Indicateur 2. 1.2: Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in primary education through UNICEF supported programmes (RAM Standard & KRC 3)
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
